google_reviews.author: Katya
google_reviews.review: They cleaned out apartment so well before moving in. Everything was spotless and new carpet. The office workers are really nice. We can hardly ever hear neighbors or upstairs, there's a nice big grassy area to walk a dog and the price is really good for the quality and size. Main downside, in my opinion, is the dated interior, which included a bathroom with consistent mold issues, but it was manageable with regular cleaning of the ceiling.

google_reviews.author: Kate Ortiz
google_reviews.review: Affordable, close to town, bus route, and other services. Month to month so good for students. I moved here because it was one of the few affordable places i could have my cats and have easy bus access to school. I've been here for two and a half years and have been very content. Quiet and warm too - hardly ever any big parties because there's not many students. Office responds to concerns quickly. Spacious. I have no complaints. Some people complain that you have to pay for laundry but it's about half the price of the Bellingham Cleaning Center nearby and it saves a ton on the electric bill. Plus you can do three loads at once! anyway, really great place to live.

google_reviews.author: Angela Johnson
google_reviews.review: I had to move when I saw someone in the parking lot using with the car door open, they didn't even live there. No response to problems, condoms and even needles found around the property. They have a security camera which one of the workers told me, it doesn't work, it's just for looks. A lot of neighbors complained of theft of of their cars. Theft from the laundry rooms. A bunch of bums and users stay in the little wooded area right by some of the parking spaces. Not worth it!!

google_reviews.author: T
google_reviews.review: DO NOT MOVE HERE! I lived here for years and there is black mold in every wall(they clean the exterior when you do inspection of unit so it doesn't show up until a few weeks after move in). The often "misplace" packages. There are drug addicts EVERYWHERE. Constant garbage on ground of premises. They will take your entire deposit(we even paid for cleaners on move out and they still took entire deposit) AND charge you over your rental amount.

google_reviews.author: Kat Man
google_reviews.review: It was a nice apartment when I first moved in it was clean and nice but got silver fish and in summer we got black ants and I talked to neighbors and they get them too and I hate the laundry room they never sanitize the washing machines and dryers one of the neighbors throws away mattresses like no other and I noticed one of the mattresses tossed and bed bug stains and it scares me and honestly the only positive thing is it's close to my work

google_reviews.author: Cori Robinson
google_reviews.review: 100% not worth the rent they charge.

yelp_reviews.author: Becky C.
yelp_reviews.review:
Honestly, they were okay-ish. 

Wen I first moved in around spring 2012, it was a shitshow and the cops had to be called all the time things broke and they raised rent way too often.

Only reason they got two stars is because management was nice to me. But ask my neighbors to remove their sign because you are racist? Nope. They did nothing wrong and were delightful people.

summary.text:
Good

This article highlights some positive sentiments about the Property Hideaway Apartments based on user reviews. Several residents have praised the affordability and size of the apartments, highlighting them as spacious and a great value for money. One user noted the cleanliness of their unit upon moving in, appreciating the condition of features like new carpets and the overall maintenance done before their arrival.

Additionally, the management seems to be responsive to tenant concerns, as indicated by feedback from some residents who reported quick responses to inquiries. Another positive aspect mentioned is the pleasant office staff and the quietness of the community, which can be particularly beneficial for students living in the area.

Great

In a few glowing reviews, users described their experiences living at Hideaway Apartments as exceptionally positive. For example, one tenant expressed satisfaction with the apartment’s proximity to public transportation and essential services, making it convenient for daily commuting. This tenant also highlighted the pet-friendliness of the property, which is a significant advantage for those with animals.

Moreover, residents appreciated certain amenities like a large grassy area for walking dogs, which enhances the living experience for pet owners. The affordability of laundry facilities was also a recurring theme, as users found the costs reasonable compared to other local options. Such features contribute to a great living environment for many tenants.

Bad

This article addresses some negative aspects reported by residents of the Property Hideaway Apartments. Several users mentioned issues with pest control, particularly mentioning instances of silverfish and ants, which raised concerns about cleanliness and maintenance standards. Although some tenants recognized that their units were clean when they moved in, these recurring pest problems have made it difficult for others to feel comfortable.

Another recurring theme in user reviews is the perception of neglect from management. Complaints about the inadequacy of responses to reports of maintenance issues were highlighted, with one resident citing serious concerns like black mold that went unaddressed for prolonged periods. These matters have contributed to an overall impression of management being less attentive to tenant welfare.

Ugly

This article captures some of the more serious grievances regarding the Property Hideaway Apartments, emphasizing severe safety and welfare concerns. One user expressed alarm over the presence of unauthorized individuals on the property, suggesting a significant security risk that management appears to overlook. Reports of drug use and theft in the area surrounding the complex have also created feelings of unease among residents.

Moreover, frustrations surrounding the handling of security deposits came up, with a tenant alleging that their entire deposit was withheld despite paying for cleaning upon moving out. Such experiences have led some residents to recommend against renting at Hideaway Apartments, depicting a troubling picture of management practices that fail to address essential tenant concerns and safety protocols.
